key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel maintained stable pricing with 83.5% of fares listed as the same as the airline's website.
The MSE channel achieved a remarkable 91.74% of its offers priced lower than the airline's website, enhancing its market appeal.
The GDS channel demonstrated high price consistency, with 76.32% of fares matching the airline's website.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The proportion of fares listed as the same on the OTA channel remained stable at 83.5% across the latest week.
The channel offered lower prices for 7.3% of itineraries last week, indicating competitive pricing challenges.
Consistently, 5.9% of fares were listed higher on the OTA channel compared to the airline's website.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The proportion of offers not available on the OTA channel rose slightly to 2.5% last week.
The same pricing ratio has remained stable with minor fluctuations, averaging 84.2% across the three timeframes.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: In the short haul category, 8.7% of fares were lower than the website prices, while 5.9% were higher in the latest week.
No lower-priced offers were recorded for long haul routes, with 5.9% of fares listed higher than the airline's prices.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For itineraries originating in Thailand, 3.2% were priced lower on the OTA channel, contrasted with 2.0% being higher.
Non-Thai origin itineraries showed higher competition with 21.9% offered at lower prices on the OTA channel.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings had a 9.8% lower price status last week, indicating a positive price competitiveness for last-minute travelers.
While far-out bookings remained mostly stable, only 2.6% were reported lower than the airlineâ€™s website prices.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel had a substantial 91.74% of offers priced lower than the airline's website in the latest week.
In the latest week, the same price status accounted for 6.65% of total offers, showing a solid presence alongside the lower-priced options.
There was a notable increase of 20.06% in frequency of MSE channel offers over the previous month, indicating growing consumer interest.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE shows 0% of total offers marked as 'Higher' than the airline's pricing, emphasizing its competitive edge.
The 'Same' status maintained at 6.65% in the latest week reflects stable pricing consistency in the market.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For short haul routes, 91.60% of offers were priced lower than the airline's website in the latest week, enhancing market attractiveness.
A significant portion of long haul options (45.45%) were priced higher than the airline website, suggesting a need for pricing strategy reassessment.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In offers originating from Thailand, 91.62% were priced lower, reinforcing the channel's competitive advantage domestically.
For non-Thai origins, 91.21% of listings were lower than the main price point, indicating a potential strategic alert for price adjustments.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: The channel maintained 93.68% lower-priced offers for close-in bookings, capturing demand effectively while maintaining competitiveness.
For far-out bookings, 88.00% of priced options were lower than the airline's own site, suggesting favorable long-term itineraries for travelers.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel maintained high price consistency with 76.32% of fares matching the airline's website in the latest week.
GDS fares were lower than website prices for 13.79% of analyzed itineraries last week, reflecting a slight increase in competitive pricing options.
In the latest month, prices on the GDS channel have shown a decreased variability, with only 6.29% of itineraries priced lower compared to 7.50% the previous month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0% of fares were found to be missing from the GDS channel in the latest week, indicating complete availability of offerings.
The percentage of prices that remained the same between the airline's website and the GDS channel held steady at 76.32% last week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Of the total fares, Thai domestic origins saw 79.13% of prices reflecting the same fare as the website, with minor fluctuations observed.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Performance for domestic point-of-origin fares showed 79.13% consistency with the airline's website, indicating strong local pricing alignment.
International fares reflected a similar trend, with 64.84% of offers matching website prices, highlighting potential pricing gaps.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings reflected 73.24% price consistency with the website, demonstrating a stable competitive positioning for last-minute travelers.
For far-out bookings, pricing remained consistent at 81.46% with the website, showing robust early booking incentives.
